intro: Adonis microcarpa var. discolor, commonly known as the variegated dwarf adonis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10-20 centimeters, with hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It prefers well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is considered rare in the wild.
